Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: Autosomal Recessive CD55 Deficiency is Associated with Protein Losing Enteropathy, Thrombosis, and Complement Dysregulation
Configuration.Description: We describe 11 patients from 8 families with homozygous LOF mutations in the complement regulatory protein CD55. Loss of CD55 is associated with increased complement activation, severe protein losing enteropathy accompanying a primary intestinal lymphangiectasia, and deep vein thrombotic events. We have named this disease CHAPLE after the principle components of the disease.
Configuration.StudyInEx:
Patient samples were chosen for inclusion in the project based on the following criteria:

  1. Families who had similar syndromic features were studied
  2. Patients, parents and other family members are available
  3. DNA was available for use in whole genome or exome sequencing
  4. Informed consent documentation
